page.title: 08AVON MILL
page.content: Avon Mill was one of the several water powered corn mills in the area. A leat ran from the River Avon to power the water wheel. In 1962 the present owners took over the mill and for a number of years used the water wheel to provide electricity for their plant nursery business. Avon Mill Nursery and Garden Centre is now a thriving concern,employing three full time and two part time people. Plants are grown to supply their own shop in Kingsbridge, and about 1000 different trees, shrubs and plants are sold there and at the Garden Centre. On the 4.5 acre site there are 10 greenhouses. Geraniums are the most popular pot plant, with over 4000 grown each year. Garden equipment, seeds, fertilizers, greenhouses, sheds and garden ornaments are sold.
